etymology.description: 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") + 也(也) (yě, phonetic) = relates to earth -> 'earth; ground'
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") indicating the earth or ground, with 也(也) (yě) as the phonetic component, suggesting the pronunciation. This combination intuitively represents the concept of earth or ground.

examples.chinese: 这块地肥沃(這塊地肥沃)。
examples.english: This piece of land is fertile.

examples.chinese: 小猫在地上(小貓在地上)，轻快地跑动(輕快地跑動)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo māo zài dì shàng, qīngkuài de pǎodòng.
examples.english: The kitten is running lightly on the ground.

examples.chinese: 我们赤脚走在潮湿的地上(我們赤腳走在潮濕的地上)，感受大地的温度(感受大地的溫度)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen chìjiǎo zǒu zài cháoshī de dì shàng, gǎnshòu dàdì de wēndù.
examples.english: We walk barefoot on the dewy ground, feeling the warmth of the earth.
